page.title: 02Landscape and Buildings
page.content: The southwest corner of this part of the heart of England is the{Severn- {Trent watershed.}The land rises from 85m in the Sow valley southward to 151m. There are few sharp changes in slope. The land undulates. Fluvio- glacial drifts lie on Keuper marls and sandstones. The fields are not large, and remain hedged. Trees dominate the valley views; they grow in frequent small coverts and in the hedgerows. In Eccleshall recent housing estates have spread south up from the High Street. Elsewhere are hamlets, isolated cott- ages and farms.{Holy Trinity church, {Eccleshall Castle}and parts of some older houses are made of local sand- stone. Little timber frame construct- ion remains visible. Most older houses are built of red brick, sometimes patterned with yellow headers. Land- scape is little changed by agriculture
